concept.title: Addresses in Swift Mailer
concept.shortdesc: Addresses are specified with a basic array syntax that can include the name associated with the address.

section.title: Syntax for Addresses
section.p: If you only wish to refer to a single email address (for example your From: address) then you can just use a string.
If you want to include a name then you must use an associative array.
If you want to include multiple addresses then you must use an array.
You can mix personalized (addresses with a name) and non-personalized addresses in the same list by mixing the use of associative and non-associative array syntax.
